title: Wold's theorem
summary: In statistics, Wold's decomposition or the Wold representation theorem (not to be confused with the Wold theorem that is the discrete-time analog of the Wienerâ€“Khinchin theorem),  named after Herman Wold, says that every covariance-stationary time series Y t {\displaystyle Y_{t}} can be written as the sum of two time series, one deterministic and one stochastic.
